description: For that reason, not interested. Wished it would work with Online Accounts.

It's fine as local client, but a task list really needs to integrate into online systems. Specifically with the CalDAV protocol, so it's not tied to a specific vendor. Online accounts integration would be a good starting place.
I really like this app. It's far more advanced than using sticky notes on my desktop. Kudos to the developers! Thanks for making a awesome app!

I am so happy this does NOT integrate with anything online, or connect to any "cloud" drive, service, storage, etc. I am fighting to get my computer back. The hardware, is mine, the data is mine, my life is mine, and I do not appreciate half the world trying to record "something" ANYTHING, about me just so they can make a buck off of it. They know that if they can't find anybody else willing to buy what they have, that the Utah Data Center will always have plenty of taxpayer dollars to help them out.
Best TODO-list app for GNOME. It's got GNOME-integration, what more could I ask for?

It is a very useful application. I would like to choose a color for text. That gives me the ability to put all the tasks for one project together by a chosen color, and all the tasks for a second project together using a second color.

Is a nice program, very easy to use,usefull and you can add plugins.
Run smootly, no crash no problems
Oh well, time for version 29

Was a great app, but nothing has been done here since 2015, so its falling very far behind the times. Would have been a great graphical app to sync with emacs org-mode! Sync options are limited and not working correctly.
But in this day and age if you can't access your tasks and todos on mobile then you are really limited. I guess the developers have moved on to other more interesting stuff. Is this really an Editors pick????
summary: Abandonware: limited sync and no development

description: so simple and so productive

I've been looking for this for the last 2 weeks. I wanted it to be simple yet to be able to help me to schedule my current tasks, see an agenda, categorize my notes and tasks and have a fast way to write down an accidental idea in just a press of a key. No doubts that GTG meets all these requirements.
Useful and a great app...
Needs a developer to help out to sync. Syncing with next cloud or syncthing or a FOSS calendar of some sort.

The 0.6 Snap Store version not supported. Only flatpack is supported and presently both a direct download from flathub and the Ubuntu flatpack version suffer a Fatal Error on loading.
 Recommend waiting until 0.6 even on flathub is replaced by a stable version, or Ubuntu issues a 0.5 or 0.6 stable version in future updates.
summary: For Ubuntu this is the only presently available functional version

description: Bitte auf deutsch das Programm, Danke.
Gute Aufgabenverwaltung, wenn man auf google-Synchronisation u.ä. verzichten kann. Tomboy-Synchronmisation funktioniert, schön wäre, wenn die evolution-Einbindung wieder funktionieren würde.

Viele Management Tools bieten To-Do-Listen zur Organistion von Tasks. Manche im Browser, andere als Teil größerer Sotfwarepakete. Für mich hat es sich jedoch als sehr nützlich herausgestellt, mit diesem so praktischen, kleinen und nativen Standalone-Manager zu arbeiten, der sich außerdem noch perfekt in die Gnome-Umgebung einfügt.

Ich konnte innerhalb 3 Minuten damit umgehen und die einfache Gliederung der Aufgaben macht Spaß. 
Oftmals sind es die einfachen Dinge, die einem am besten helfen oder erinnern "Sachen zu erledigen". Genau so ein Werkzeug ist hier entstanden.
summary: Schön einfach und dennoch sehr funktionell

description: Es lo suficientemente simple para resultar útil.
Нет синхронизации с Задачами Google.

Может есть и другие хорошие приложения, но это первое что реально помогло. Многие таск менеджеры, отбивают заниматься планированием задач. Тут же все просто, на виду, легко создавать, редактировать, не напрягает мозг.
summary: Лучшее что я видел в жизни
